Package org.engine.input

Class KeyInput

java.lang.Object
org.engine.input.KeyInput
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.jogamp.newt.event.KeyListener, com.jogamp.newt.event.NEWTEventListener, java.util.EventListener
public class KeyInput
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.jogamp.newt.event.KeyListener
The KeyInput class implements the KeyListener interface provided in the JOGL library. It keeps track of the state of the keyboard and passes that information on to the rest of the engine where needed.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static void clear()
    Resets all the flags used by the listener to false, effectively clearing all the previous input information
    static short getLastKeyPressed()
    Fetches the code of the last key pressed in the current update cycle
    static boolean isKeyAvailable()
    Checks if any key was pressed in the last update cycle
    static boolean keyDown​(int keyCode)
    Checks to see if the given key was just pressed this update cycle, useful for actions that require a one-time press only since it returns false if key is held for two or more update cycles
    static boolean keyHeld​(int keyCode)
    Checks if the given key was held for at least two update cycles

  • Method Details

    • loadBindings

      private static void loadBindings()
      Load/Set control bindings from the preferences.txt file. If no file is present, it creates it

    • saveBindings

      public static void saveBindings()
      Saves the current control bindings in the preferences.txt file

      public void keyPressed​(com.jogamp.newt.event.KeyEvent keyEvent)

      Specified by:
      keyReleased in interface com.jogamp.newt.event.KeyListener

    • update

      public static void update()
      Updates the necessary flags. Should be called once per update cycle.

    • keyDown

      public static boolean keyDown​(int keyCode)
      Checks to see if the given key was just pressed this update cycle, useful for actions that require a one-time press only since it returns false if key is held for two or more update cycles
      Parameters:
      keyCode - the code of the required key (available as constant int the JOGL KeyEvent class)

    • keyHeld

      public static boolean keyHeld​(int keyCode)
      Checks if the given key was held for at least two update cycles
      Parameters:
      keyCode - the code of the required key (available as constant int the JOGL KeyEvent class)

    • isKeyAvailable

      public static boolean isKeyAvailable()
      Checks if any key was pressed in the last update cycle
      Returns:
      true if any key was pressed during the last update cycle

    • getLastKeyPressed

      public static short getLastKeyPressed()
      Fetches the code of the last key pressed in the current update cycle
      Returns:
      the short UNICODE value of the last key pressed

    • clear

      public static void clear()
      Resets all the flags used by the listener to false, effectively clearing all the previous input information
